subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*ka-n||crow}}. Cognate with {{och-l|烏|crow; raven}}. The Middle Chinese of {{lang|zh|鴉}} retains the earlier vowel. 

{{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} disputes {{cog|och|-}} reconstructions with medial ''*-r-'', reasoning that {{lang|zh|鴉}}'s place among Division II syllables (often from Old Chinese syllables containing ''*-r-'') results rather from archaism which preserves the original vowel's quality.
